page.title: 16 - CHURCHES IN THE AREA
page.content: This was once upon a time a very important part of the local scene but like agriculture, has become less and less important. All Saints is the parish church of Duncton and was built in 1868. It has one of the oldest inscribed bells in England, dating from 1369 and still rings in the belltower.In the churchyard is a memorial to Robert de Grenier de Fanblanque whose wife once led a suffragette march from Edinburgh to London in 1912.The rector is the Rev.Alan Bucknell of Tillington and services are held at 6:30 pm on Sundays. The Roman Catholic church at Duncton is dedicated to St. Anthony and St. George and was also built in 1868. The priest is Father Henry Hill who lives in Angel Street, Petworth. Masses are held at 8:30 am on Sundays.
